intro: Acronema xizangense, commonly known as the Sichuan acronema, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small and white or greenish, arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Acronema xizangense is often found in moist, shaded environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
